intro: Cyrtandra incrustata, commonly known as the crusty cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its unique, often hairy or scaly leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
